metadata.Title: CVE-2022-42719 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free in the mac80211 stack when parsing a multi-BSSID element in the Linux kernel 5.2 through 5.19.x before 5.19.16 could be used by attackers (able to inject WLAN frames) to crash the kernel and potentially execute code. Sönke Huster discovered that a use-after-free vulnerability existed in the WiFi driver stack in the Linux kernel. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42719` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-36-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-6.2.0-36-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-36-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-36-generic-64k - 5.19.0-23.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1010-azure - 5.19.0-1010.11
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-36-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-6.2.0-36-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-36-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-36-generic-64k - 5.19.0-23.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1010-azure - 5.19.0-1010.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: backport-iwlwifi-dkms package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-23.24').
linux-aws package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
